articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Hezbollah and Israel seemed content to let Sunday's attack, in retaliation for the killing of a senior Hezbollah commander in Beirut last month, count as settled for the moment.
articles.title: Israel says situation on Lebanon border 'not sustainable'

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ramadan Abed
articles.description: Israel issued new evacuation orders for Deir Al-Balah in the central Gaza Strip late on Sunday, forcing more families to flee, saying forces intended to act against militant group Hamas and others operating in the area.
articles.title: Families flee after new Israeli evacuation orders in Gaza as ceasefire hopes dim

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich
articles.description: The sound of explosions rang out in central Kyiv on Monday morning during rush hour as Ukraine's military warned of a massive Russian missile and drone attack following waves of drone attacks in the early hours.
articles.title: Russia launches massive missile and drone attack on Ukraine, Kyiv says

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel, Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: Pavel Durov, the Russian-born founder of Telegram who was arrested in Paris, has nothing to hide it is absurd to hold an owner responsible for abuse of the messaging and social media platform, Telegram said in a statement.
articles.title: Pavel Durov, detained in France, has nothing to hide, Telegram says

articles.author: Saleem Ahmad, Saud Mehsud
articles.description: Separatist militant attacks on police stations, railway lines and highways in Pakistan's restive province of Balochistan, coupled with retaliatory operations by security forces, killed at least 51 people, officials said on Monday.
articles.title: More than 50 killed after militant attacks in Pakistan's Balochistan

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Vast areas of land are submerged, posing a significant threat to crops if the floodwaters linger for an extended period.
articles.title: Bangladesh floods leave 23 dead, 5.7 million people affected

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hot mics can help or hurt political candidates, catching off-hand comments that sometimes were not meant for the public.
articles.title: Trump threatens to pull out of Harris debate, hot mics an issue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Monday it had seen media reports about the death of a Reuters safety adviser in a missile strike on a Ukrainian hotel, and that Moscow targeted only military infrastructure in Ukraine.
articles.title: Kremlin says it has seen media reports on death of Reuters safety adviser in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Italian prosecutors have placed under investigation the captain of the superyacht that sank off Sicily last week in a storm, killing British tech magnate Mike Lynch and six other people, a judicial source said on Monday.
articles.title: Captain of sunken Lynch family yacht put under investigation, source says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela's attorney general's office said on Monday it has issued a second summons for opposition leader Edmundo Gonzalez to attend questioning about an opposition website which published detailed results of the country's disputed presidential election last month.
articles.title: Venezuelan attorney general's office issues second summons for opposition leader Gonzalez
